greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = Sum_{d|n} sigma(d) mod d.
comment: a(n) >= A054024(n). Conjecture: a(n) = A054024(n) only for the noncomposite numbers A008578.
a(p*q) = 3+p+q if p < q are distinct primes and q>3.
a(p^k) = (p^(k+1)-(1+k)*p + k)/(p-1)^2 if p is prime and k >= 0. (End)
link: Robert Israel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
example: For n = 4; a(n) = (sigma(1) mod 1 + sigma(2) mod 2 + sigma(4) mod 4) = (0 + 1 + 3) = 4.
maple: A300657 := n -> add(numtheory:-sigma(d) mod d, d = numtheory:-divisors(n)):
mathematica: Fold[Function[{a, n}, Append[a, {Total@ Map[a[[#, -1]] &, Most@ Divisors@ n] + #, #} &@ Mod[DivisorSigma[1, n], n]]], {{0, 0}}, Range[2, 72]][[All, 1]] (* _Michael De Vlieger_, Mar 10 2018 *)
program: (MAGMA) [(&+[SumOfDivisors(d) mod d: d in Divisors(n)]): n in [1..100]]
(PARI) a(n) = sumdiv(n, d, sigma(d) % d); \\ _Michel Marcus_, Mar 11 2018
results.author: _Jaroslav Krizek_, Mar 10 2018
